They must be patient. It was the most prudent plan. The exchange offered chances that neither an open attack nor a flight across these unknown regions could afford.
contradicting_spans: He trained twelve English-speaking youths as spies, sent them into Auckland; two became servants who secretly watched Glenarvan.

analysis.claim_text: He trained twelve English-speaking youths as spies, sent them into Auckland; two became servants who secretly watched Glenarvan.

sub_claims.text: He trained twelve English-speaking youths as spies.
Two became servants who secretly watched Glenarvan.

analysis.reasoning: Contradiction (capability): The claim states that Kai-Koumou trained twelve English-speaking youths as spies and sent them into Auckland to secretly watch Glenarvan. However, the evidence from the novel shows that Kai-Koumou only had ten natives on board the canoe who joined him, and they were not spies but warriors who had recently fought against the English troops.
